page.title: 07KNOWLE HOSPITAL,N.FAREHAM.
page.content: Knowle Hospital was built in 1830 as the County Lunatic Asylum.The imposing,red brick building stands above the valley of the river Meon in it's own large grounds surrounded by woods and farmland and reached only by a narrow lane.Today it is a national health service mental hospital housing about 400 mentally ill patients.Many new buildings have been added in recent years,such as nurses' homes, open accomadation for patients and an education and assessment centre.There are also playing fields,a swimming pool and a church which are open for public use.
